channel.title: How to DDoS yourself with Google Spreadsheets
channel.description:
http://www.behind-the-enemy-lines.com/2012/04/google-attack-how-i-self-attacked.html
Just heading home but i skim read this quickly and thought it was worthy of a post, interesting and fairly amusing.

item.title: How to DDoS yourself with Google Spreadsheets
item.dc:creator: @nueb35 Nueb35
item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

[quote=“BloodRayne, post:5, topic:440692”][quote author=Nueb35 link=topic=543365.msg3983495#msg3983495 date=1335579131]
I wonder if they will somehow fix this. As he said, the reason for it are legitimate design decisions
[/quote]

Unless it becomes heavily abused I can’t really see them fixing it as it isn’t a problem unless people abuse it

With this article coming out though I’m not sure if people will start to abuse it or what, will be interesting to see[/quote]

Minecraft uses an amazon server of that same type, lets begin abusing!

Read full topic
item.source: How to DDoS yourself with Google Spreadsheets

item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

It’s weird though, afaik google spreadsheets have limits on the number of actions you can invoke per day? ;o

I would assume the 50 functions calling external data would include images, but I guess not

The Google attack: How I attacked myself using Google Spreadsheets and I ramped...

It all started with an email. From: Amazon Web Services LLC Subject: Review of your AWS Account Estimated Month to Date Billing Ch...
